text:
Hey <@U01QBQGJREJ> I've never had formal training in marketing but I've worked with numerous Fortune companies, Airbnb, and am currently at eBay in Payments, even though I don't have a banking background.

The tl;dr of what I've experienced is that companies specifically care about the portfolio, what you have done, and how you relate it to their objectives.

I got into Airbnb by calling out my work with Iron Mountain, and saying how a similar concept could help. For eBay, it was an email campaign for TEDxSanFrancisco with a 70's pop culture reference that got me in.

Generally speaking, for CMM roles, I'd focus on your approach to developing content, how to set an editorial calendar, how to evaluate content performance.

Those are the key things companies are looking for a CMM role. In my interviews, I haven't had companies ask me for examples of formal education. All they care about is what you've done in the real-world and how you can contribute to their needs.
